22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:14): ISSUE-119 -- Consider adding input/keyboard locale to text and keyboard events -- raised
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:14): http://www.w3.org/2008/webapps/track/issues/119
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:14): Topic: input/keyboard locale
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:15): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Not clear before that this was a requirement for this spec.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:16): .. Does not appear to be difficult to implement
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:16): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: Linux could be a problem, this info may not be exposed..
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:16): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: For platforms that do expose this info, it doesn't seem like it would be difficult to implement
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:17): .. Depending on the platform, it may not be available/dependable.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:17): ... May not be accurate in all scenarios.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:17): ... as a heuristic, content authors are willing to say good enough.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:18): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: We can spec it such that if the platform/OS doesn't support providing this info, then the value could be null (n/a)
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:19): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: Where is the keyboard layouts defined?
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:19): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Couldn't find a standard for reporting the keyboard layout--also couldn't find something for the keybaord language.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:20): ... I could have an English Dvorak keyboard!
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:20): ... For the language, I think we should just go with en-US style
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:20): ... (Can't think of the term for this format)
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (20:21): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-dom/2010JulSep/0138.html
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:21): BCP-47 tag (e.g. "en-US")
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:22): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: Notes that "navigator.systemLanguage" returns a similar language code: "en-us"
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:23): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Probably requires a list of conversions from OS-defined langauge codes to BCP-47

d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:26): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: Related to the issue, I have a preference that the keyboard lang info be provided as a global property (on document?) and that we create an event that notifies of changes (which are not expected to occur very frequently)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:26): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-dom/2010JulSep/0141.html
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:27): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: Not sure I understand the threat.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:27): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: It allows profiling of users
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:29): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: I would argue that the navigator object allows a higher-degree of profling (see navigator.platform in HTML5)
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:30): ... Also, my goal is to limit the amount of information we provide in the event that is largely redundant.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:31): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: If you copy/paste something, the input-locale could be different than if the user is just typing text.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:31): travis: good point.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:32): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: In order to specify this correctly... consider:
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:32): ... when something is copied, is the source language prerved?
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:33): s/prerved/preserved/
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:33): ... does this impose a requirement on an OS?
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:34): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: TextInput and Keyboard events.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:35): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: Sounds like we have accepted this comment.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:35): RESOLUTION: Accept issue 119, and add inputLocale to TextInput and Keyboard events.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:37): Topic: Issue 120 move scroll from UIEvent to Event
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:38): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I think it logically belongs in UI events, even if it traditionally hasn't been a UIEvent, I don't see how it breaks.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:39): ... it might be argued that is sends extraneous information (null/ empty string)
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:39): ... Any code that characterizes events based on its interface, it makes more sense to make it a UIEvent.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:40): ... Makes it consistent with our model.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:40): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: I have no argument for or against this issue.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:40): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: It is a non-goal for me to document the behavior as it exists in browsers today.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:41): ... my goal is to create a consistent and logical model that forms a solid foundation for future events and content.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:41): ... Since the folks on the call don't have a strong opinion, then I'd like to keep this event the way it is.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:42): RESOLUTION: Keep scroll as a UIEvent, pending further feedback from implementors
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:42): Topic: Issue 121: generalize textInput to cover all user-initiated changes
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:44): Note: Jacob Rossi joins the call from d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7' phone
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:45): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: This sounds like mutation events.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:45): JRossi: textInput sounded like the catch-all for input, without the rest of this requests in the Issue.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:47): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: Notes that the "input" event exists that covers more of these cases (removals of characters, addition of characters, etc.)
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:47): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: I'm interested in deferring this request, and not doing this in DOM L3 Events.

d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:48): ... I'd like to propose that we keep it the way it is for now. If we decide to accept this workitem, that it could be a standalone spec that adds the new event and details the new event exhaustively, it's relationship to textInput, etc.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:49): ... By adding it into this spec, we may not get the implementation feedback that we've had so far.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:50): ... Based on the details of how this new event would be speced, it could be compared to textInput.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:50): JRossi: Could we consider changing the name? from textInput to beforeInput.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:51): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: This event is already implemented (for some time) in WebKit and now in IE9.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:52): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: On the surface this proposal (Issue 212) seems pretty complex (with lots of cases).
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:52): RESOLUTION: counter-propose that the beforeInput event be a separate event that is defined in its own spec.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:53): Topic: Issue 122 add mousewheel event back.

d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:55): d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7: The mousewheel event was originally pulled from this spec because we (Microsoft) felt that mousewheel didn't 1) convey all the information that was appropriate for a future-looking wheel event, 2) scenarios covered by mosuewheel are also covered by wheel event, 3) implementation support for mousewheel is spotty (not available in Mozilla's Firefox).
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:57): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: mousewheel doesn't have all the features.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:57): JRossi: only one-direction scrolling, doesn't handle pixel/line/etc.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:57): ... Also confusing from a consistency (intra-spec) to have both events.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:58): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: A lot of existing content special-cases mousewheel and other wheel-related events.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:58): ... If we specified it, and browsers changed their implementations, existing content might break.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (20:59): ... better to let it fade with time and exist in specific implementations idiosyncratic-ly. (known spelling issue <---)
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:00): RESOLUTION: The group will not re-add mousewheel event back to the spec.
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:02): Topic: Issue 126: isTrusted
d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:03): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: I believe we used 'trusted' because of alignment with XBL2

d5217991a5c7374b110deb03905676f7 (21:06): RESOLUTION: Change 'trusted' to 'isTrusted' :-)
